p: Suspected cases of dengue are identified and notified from the healthcare units ( Figure 1a) through the online portal or paper forms ( Figure 1b). Laboratory confirmation is conducted by the Central Laboratory of Public Health ( Figure 1c), and the data are analyzed by the Directory of Epidemiological Surveillance ( Figure 1d). The Directory of Epidemiological Surveillance is also responsible for response activities ( Figure 1e), along with the Directory of Environmental Surveillance, which conducts vector control ( Figure 1e,f). The model also shows support activities, which are conducted by the Ministry of Health ( Figure 1g).
